definitions.definition: To obtain , arrange , or achieve by indirect , complicated and/or intensive efforts .
To obtain , arrange , or achieve by deceitful methods, by trickery .
examples: finagled his way out of a ticket by pretending to be on the way to a funeral, distraught

definitions.definition: To cheat or swindle ; to use crafty , deceitful methods. (often with "out of" preceding the object)
examples: shady stockbrokers who finagle their clients out of fortunes.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To obtain , arrange , or achieve by indirect , complicated and/or intensive efforts .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To obtain , arrange , or achieve by deceitful methods, by trickery .
( ambitransitive ) To cheat or swindle ; to use crafty , deceitful methods. (often with "out of" preceding the object)
